meanings.definition: A support used by an injured or disabled person to assist with walking.
meanings.sent1: After hurting his leg, he needed a crutch to help him walk.
meanings.sent2: The old man leaned on his crutch as he slowly made his way down the street.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown tried to juggle while balancing on a crutch, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was her crutch during difficult times, keeping her spirits up.
meanings.sent5: The crutch creaked under his weight, reminding him of his temporary reliance on it.

meanings.definition: Something that is relied upon for support or assistance.
meanings.sent1: For some people, coffee is their morning crutch to wake up.
meanings.sent2: His smartphone became his crutch, always by his side for quick information.
meanings.sent3: The lucky charm he carried in his pocket was his crutch for good luck.
meanings.sent4: Music was her crutch, soothing her soul in times of stress.
meanings.sent5: Her best friend was her emotional crutch, always there to listen and support.

meanings.definition: To support or prop up with a crutch.
meanings.sent1: She had to crutch the wobbly table leg to keep it from shaking.
meanings.sent2: The builder used extra beams to crutch the weakened structure of the house.
meanings.sent3: He tried to crutch his failing project with last-minute changes, but it was too late.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them crutched each other through tough times.
meanings.sent5: Her encouraging words crutched his confidence, helping him overcome his fears.
